alert.note: Alert for Clinch; Northern Ware; Southern Ware; Western Charlton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 15 at 4:22PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT CENTRAL WARE...EAST CENTRAL CLINCH AND NORTHWESTERN CHARLTON COUNTIES THROUGH 445 PM EDT... At 422 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles northwest of Stephen Foster State Park, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 45 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of central Ware, east central Clinch and northwestern Charlton Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Clinch; Northern Ware; Southern Ware; Western Charlton
